channel.title: Posts on Jose Alquicira Hernandez
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jose Alquicira Hernandez

item.title: scPred integration with Seurat
item.description: In this tutorial, I’ll show how to incorporate prediction analyses using Seurat along with scPred. First, we’ll load scPred and the tidyverse: library(scPred) library(tidyverse) Let’s load Seurat: library(Seurat) We’ll work with a dataset obtained to analyze the ventral midbrain development in human (see Molecular Diversity of Midbrain Development in Mouse, Human, and Stem Cells). The data will be downloaded from Hemberg’s lab: download.file("https://scrnaseq-public-datasets.s3.amazonaws.com/scater-objects/manno_human.rds", destfile = "~/Downloads/manno_human.rds") Then we import the data and convert the scater object into Seurat

item.title: Introduction to scPred
item.description: Summary scPred is a general method to predict cell types based on variance structure decomposition. It selects the most cell type-informative principal components from a dataset and trains a prediction model for each cell type. The principal training axes are projected onto the test dataset to obtain the PCs scores for the test dataset and the trained model(s) is/are used to classify single cells. For more details see our pre-print on bioRxiv:

item.title: My first post
item.description: I will periodically post articles related to genomics, computational biology, statistics and R. I hope you have fun!
